definitions: gradual repayment of debt through regular payments over time
accounting method that spreads the cost of an intangible asset over its useful life
examples: The mortgage amortization schedule showed payments for thirty years
Monthly amortization reduced the principal balance substantially over time
Software amortization appeared as a quarterly expense on financial statements
The company recorded amortization of patents over their legal life

definitions: specific quantity or measurement of something countable or measurable
sum of money or numerical value representing a total
examples: The amount of rainfall exceeded normal levels this month
A small amount of sugar improves the recipe significantly
The invoice amount includes taxes and delivery charges
Please verify the amount before processing the payment

definitions: secret or illicit love affair, especially one of brief duration
feeling of romantic love or passionate attachment between people
examples: Their amour lasted only through the summer months
The novel depicted a forbidden amour between enemies
French poetry often celebrates amour in its verses
His amour for her remained strong despite the distance

definitions: shortened form of ampere, the standard unit of electrical current
electronic device that increases the power of audio signals
examples: The circuit requires a fifteen amp fuse for safety
Most household outlets provide fifteen or twenty amps
His guitar amp produced incredible sound at the concert
The band's vintage amp collection was worth thousands

definitions: standard international unit of electric current equal to one coulomb per second
examples: The motor draws ten amperes at full load
Scientists measure current flow in amperes using specialized instruments
One ampere equals approximately six quintillion electrons passing per second
The ampere is named after physicist André-Marie Ampère

definitions: synthetic stimulant drug that affects the central nervous system
prescribed medication used to treat ADHD and narcolepsy conditions
examples: Illegal amphetamine use can cause serious health problems
The laboratory tested for amphetamine presence in samples
Her doctor prescribed amphetamine for attention deficit disorder treatment
Medical amphetamine requires careful dosage monitoring by healthcare professionals

definitions: cold-blooded vertebrate animal that lives both in water and on land
vehicle designed to operate both on land and in water
examples: The frog is a common amphibian found in ponds
Scientists study amphibian populations to monitor environmental health
Military amphibian vehicles crossed rivers during the operation
The amphibian aircraft landed smoothly on the lake

definitions: open-air venue with tiered seating arranged around a central performance area
indoor auditorium with semicircular seating rising from a central stage
examples: The Roman amphitheater hosted gladiator battles centuries ago
Summer concerts filled the outdoor amphitheater every weekend
Medical students gathered in the amphitheater for anatomy demonstrations
The university amphitheater accommodated five hundred students comfortably

definitions: open-air venue with tiered seating arranged around a central performance area
indoor auditorium with semicircular seating rising from a central stage
examples: The Greek amphitheatre showcased dramatic performances under starlight
Tourists visited the ancient amphitheatre ruins in Athens
Students filed into the medical amphitheatre for surgery observation
The amphitheatre's acoustics carried voices to every seat

definitions: tall ancient Greek or Roman jar with two handles and narrow neck for storing wine or oil
examples: Archaeologists discovered intact amphora containing ancient wine residue
The museum displayed amphora from Mediterranean shipwrecks
Roman amphora transported olive oil across the empire
Each amphora bore stamps identifying its origin and contents

definitions: process of increasing the strength or magnitude of electrical signals
act of expanding or elaborating on ideas, statements, or narratives
examples: Audio amplification made the speaker audible throughout the hall
The circuit provides amplification of weak radio signals
His amplification of the original story added unnecessary details
The report needed amplification of key findings and recommendations

definitions: electronic device that increases the power or amplitude of electrical signals
audio equipment component that boosts sound signals for speakers
examples: The radio amplifier strengthened weak broadcast signals effectively
Engineers designed a new amplifier with minimal distortion
The concert amplifier powered massive speaker arrays flawlessly
Guitar players often prefer tube amplifiers for warmth

definitions: maximum displacement or distance of a wave from its equilibrium position
breadth, range, or magnitude of something abstract or physical
examples: The earthquake's amplitude registered strongly on seismographs worldwide
Sound wave amplitude determines the volume we perceive
The amplitude of temperature variation affects crop growth patterns
Her research covered topics of remarkable amplitude and depth

definitions: surgical removal of a body part, typically a limb, for medical reasons
loss of a body part due to accident, injury, or trauma
examples: Diabetes complications necessitated amputation of his lower leg
The surgeon performed an amputation to prevent infection spread
The accident resulted in traumatic amputation requiring emergency treatment
Battlefield amputation saved many soldiers' lives during wartime

definitions: person who has had one or more limbs surgically removed or lost through trauma
examples: The amputee learned to walk with a prosthetic leg
Support groups help amputee patients adjust to life changes
War amputee veterans receive specialized rehabilitation services nationwide
The paralympic amputee athlete inspired millions with her achievements

definitions: small object worn or carried as protection against evil, danger, or disease
examples: Ancient warriors wore amulet pendants for battlefield protection
The Egyptian amulet featured hieroglyphic symbols of power
Her grandmother's amulet had been passed through generations
Museum visitors examined amulet collections from various cultures

definitions: activity or attraction designed to entertain and provide enjoyment
state of finding something entertaining or pleasantly diverting
examples: The amusement park attracted millions of visitors annually
Children found endless amusement in the playground equipment
His amusement at the joke was evident from his laughter
She watched with amusement as the puppies played together

definitions: something that belongs to a different time period than the one being portrayed or discussed
examples: The movie's anachronism included modern watches in medieval scenes
Using typewriters today seems like an anachronism
Historical anachronism in the novel distracted educated readers
The professor pointed out several anachronism errors in the documentary

definitions: large non-venomous snake native to South America that kills prey by constriction
examples: The green anaconda can grow over twenty feet long
Wildlife photographers searched the Amazon for anaconda sightings
An anaconda can remain underwater for ten minutes while hunting
The zoo's anaconda required special handling during feeding

definitions: medical condition characterized by insufficient red blood cells or hemoglobin in blood
examples: Iron deficiency causes the most common type of anaemia
The doctor prescribed supplements to treat her anaemia
Chronic anaemia left patients feeling constantly exhausted and weak
Blood tests confirmed anaemia requiring immediate medical intervention

definitions: medically induced temporary loss of sensation or awareness for surgical procedures
partial or complete loss of feeling in a body area
examples: General anaesthesia was required for the complex surgery
The anaesthesia took effect within minutes of administration
Local anaesthesia numbed only the surgical area effectively
Patients recovered from anaesthesia in the recovery room

definitions: drug or agent that produces temporary loss of bodily sensations, especially pain
examples: The dentist applied local anaesthetic before the procedure
Modern anaesthetic drugs have fewer side effects than predecessors
Anaesthetic cream numbed the skin before injection administration
The surgeon selected appropriate anaesthetic for the operation

definitions: medical professional trained to administer anesthetics and monitor patients during surgery
examples: The anaesthetist monitored vital signs throughout the operation
An experienced anaesthetist joined the surgical team
The anaesthetist explained the procedure before surgery began
Hospital anaesthetist schedules coordinated with surgical planning

definitions: word or phrase formed by rearranging the letters of another word or phrase
examples: The anagram of 'listen' cleverly becomes 'silent'
Puzzle enthusiasts solved complex anagram challenges daily
Creating anagram clues added difficulty to the crossword
The author hid character names as anagram throughout

definitions: medication or substance that relieves pain without causing loss of consciousness
examples: The doctor prescribed strong analgesic for post-surgical pain
Over-the-counter analgesic options include aspirin and ibuprofen
Topical analgesic cream provided relief from muscle aches
Natural analgesic compounds exist in certain plant extracts

definitions: technology or signal that uses continuous physical variables rather than digital
something comparable or similar to something else in certain respects
examples: Analog recordings capture sound waves as continuous signals
Musicians prefer analog synthesizers for their warm sound
The heart serves as an analog to a pump
This situation has no analog in recent history

definitions: technology or signal that uses continuous physical variables rather than digital
something comparable or similar to something else in certain respects
examples: Analogue watches display time with moving hands continuously
The studio restored old analogue tape recordings digitally
Scientists found an analogue compound with similar properties
This medieval practice has no modern analogue today

definitions: comparison between two things to explain or clarify by showing similarities
correspondence or partial similarity between things otherwise unlike
examples: The teacher used an analogy comparing cells to factories
His analogy between computers and brains clarified the concept
The analogy between heart function and pump mechanics helps understanding
Drawing analogy from nature inspired the engineering solution

definitions: professional who examines and interprets complex data or information
psychoanalyst who provides therapy through analysis of mental processes
examples: The financial analyst predicted market trends accurately
Business analyst recommendations improved operational efficiency significantly
The analyst helped her understand unconscious behavior patterns
After seeing an analyst, his anxiety decreased considerably

definitions: device or software that performs systematic examination of data or substances
instrument that measures and evaluates specific properties or components
examples: The network analyzer detected several security vulnerabilities quickly
Blood analyzer machines process hundreds of samples daily
The spectrum analyzer displayed radio frequency signal patterns
Quality control used gas analyzer for emissions testing

definitions: political belief that government and laws are unnecessary and should be abolished
examples: Anarchism advocates for stateless societies based on voluntary cooperation
The professor taught courses on anarchism and political theory
Historical anarchism movements influenced labor organizing worldwide significantly
Modern anarchism encompasses diverse philosophical and practical approaches

definitions: person who believes in or advocates anarchism as political philosophy
person who promotes disorder or works against organized government
examples: The anarchist wrote extensively about voluntary cooperation principles
Police arrested anarchist protesters at the demonstration
Historical anarchist thinkers influenced modern libertarian philosophy significantly
The anarchist collective organized mutual aid programs locally

definitions: state of society without government or law enforcement authority
situation of total disorder resulting from absence of authority or control
examples: Political anarchy followed the government's sudden collapse
The region descended into anarchy after war ended
Classroom anarchy erupted when the teacher left unexpectedly
Traffic anarchy resulted from the power outage

definitions: something or someone that is detested, loathed, or strongly opposed
formal ecclesiastical curse involving excommunication from religious community
examples: Violence was anathema to her peaceful philosophy completely
The proposal was anathema to conservative party members
The church pronounced anathema against heretical teachings formally
Medieval anathema rituals included symbolic bell tolling

definitions: scientist who studies the physical structure of organisms, especially through dissection
examples: The anatomist discovered a previously unknown nerve pathway
Renaissance anatomist Leonardo da Vinci created detailed drawings
Medical school anatomist taught students through cadaver dissection
The anatomist published groundbreaking research on organ development

definitions: scientific study of bodily structure of organisms and their parts
detailed examination or analysis of something complex broken into components
examples: Medical students studied human anatomy through dissection labs
Comparative anatomy reveals evolutionary relationships between species
The book provided an anatomy of corporate corruption
His anatomy of the conflict examined all contributing factors

definitions: person from whom one is descended, typically more remote than grandparent
early type of animal or plant from which others evolved
examples: Her ancestor arrived from Ireland during the famine
Family records traced ancestor connections back ten generations
The wolf is the ancestor of all domestic dogs
Scientists discovered the ancestor species through fossil evidence

definitions: one's family or ethnic descent traced through generations of relatives
inherited genetic and cultural background from previous generations
examples: DNA testing revealed unexpected ancestry from multiple continents
She researched her ancestry through historical documents
Their ancestry included Native American and European heritage
The ancestry database contained millions of genealogical records

definitions: heavy device dropped to bottom of water to hold vessel in place
main news presenter who coordinates television or radio broadcast
person or thing that provides stability or confidence
examples: The ship dropped anchor in the protected harbor
Strong currents dragged the anchor across the seabed
The news anchor reported breaking developments live
She became lead anchor after years of field reporting
He served as the team's emotional anchor during crisis
The store was the mall's anchor attracting other businesses

definitions: designated area where ships can safely drop anchor and moor
point where something is firmly attached or secured to support
examples: The natural anchorage protected vessels from storm winds
Ships waited in the anchorage for harbor clearance
Bridge cable anchorage points required massive concrete foundations
The climbing anchorage failed under extreme load conditions

definitions: male television or radio news presenter who hosts main broadcasts
final runner or swimmer in a relay race team
examples: The veteran anchorman retired after thirty years broadcasting
The anchorman delivered breaking news with professional composure
Their fastest swimmer served as anchorman in relays
The anchorman made up lost ground in the final lap

definitions: small oily fish often preserved in salt or oil as food
examples: Pizza topped with anchovy appeals to adventurous eaters
Mediterranean cuisine frequently incorporates anchovy in sauces
Fresh anchovy tastes milder than the preserved variety
The Caesar dressing contained anchovy paste for umami

definitions: person who lived in ancient times or is extremely old
examples: The ancient shared wisdom from decades of experience
Village ancient recalled events from the previous century
Greek ancient philosophers influenced Western thought profoundly
The ancient in the nursing home celebrated turning one hundred

definitions: musical tempo marking indicating moderately slow pace, walking speed
examples: The symphony's andante movement provided peaceful contrast
She played the andante passage with expressive phrasing
Mozart's andante in C major demonstrates classical elegance
The conductor took the andante slightly faster than marked

definitions: robot designed to resemble and act like a human being
mobile operating system developed by Google for smartphones and tablets
examples: The android moved with surprisingly human-like gestures
Science fiction often features android characters questioning humanity
Her android phone runs the latest operating system
Android apps dominate the mobile application market globally

definitions: spiral galaxy nearest to the Milky Way visible from Earth
princess in Greek mythology rescued by Perseus from sea monster
genus of evergreen shrubs in the heather family
examples: The Andromeda galaxy appears as a fuzzy patch through binoculars
Astronomers study Andromeda to understand galaxy formation
The constellation depicts Andromeda chained to rocks
Perseus saved Andromeda from the sea monster Cetus
Wild andromeda thrives in acidic bog environments naturally
Garden andromeda produces clusters of small bell-shaped flowers

definitions: short amusing or interesting story about a real incident or person
examples: His anecdote about the wedding mishap entertained everyone
The speaker opened with a humorous anecdote
Personal anecdote made the presentation more engaging and relatable
She collected anecdote from veterans for her book

definitions: medical condition with insufficient red blood cells or hemoglobin in blood
examples: Iron supplements helped correct her anemia effectively
Chronic anemia caused persistent fatigue and weakness
The blood test revealed severe anemia requiring treatment
Sickle cell anemia affects millions of people worldwide

definitions: colorful flowering plant with delicate petals found in gardens and wild
marine animal with tentacles that attaches to rocks resembling a flower
examples: Spring anemone bloomed in vibrant colors throughout the garden
Wood anemone carpeted the forest floor in white
The clownfish lived symbiotically within the sea anemone
Tide pool anemone closed when touched by curious fingers

definitions: medically induced temporary loss of sensation or awareness for surgical procedures
partial or complete loss of feeling in a body area
examples: General anesthesia kept the patient unconscious during surgery
The anesthesia wore off gradually in the recovery room
Regional anesthesia blocked pain in the lower body only
Complications from anesthesia occur rarely with modern techniques
